info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:16PM EDT until August 12 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR MERCER COUNTY... At 516 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Greenville, or near Sharpsville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Hermitage, Sharon, Sharpsville, Greenville, Mercer, Stoneboro, Sandy Lake, Clark, Fredonia, Jackson Center, New Lebanon, Sheakleyville, and Maurice K Goddard State Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northwestern Pennsylvania. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
